snippet: Floyd Mayweather Jr., who dismantled Robert Guerrero on Saturday night, should have a place among the greats, but his legacy is more complicated.
abstract: Greg Bishop On Boxing column observes that after Floyd Mayweather Jr dismantled overmatched Robert Guerrero in welterweight title fight, debate about his place in boxing history resumed; holds that Mayweather, who is mix of subtle boxer and flamboyant personality, should have a place among the greats, but his legacy is more complicated.
lead_paragraph: Floyd Mayweather Jr., who dismantled Robert Guerrero on Saturday night, should have a place among the greats, but his legacy is more complicated.

headline.seo: Floyd Mayweather Jr., a Ring Virtuoso, Is Still Fighting to Be Appreciated
headline.main: A Ring Virtuoso, Fighting for Respect
headline.print_headline: A Ring Virtuoso, Fighting for Respect
